name: federated
content:
federated adjective
(STATES)
Add to word list
Add to word list
consisting of a group of organizations, countries, regions, etc. that have joined together to form a larger organization or government: Brazil is a federated republic, with a civil law system. Federated systems guard against an overconcentration of power at the national level. the Federated States of Micronesia
More examplesFewer examplesIndependent or loosely federated provinces, with disparate interests, laws, governments, and customs tariffs, have been consolidated into a single nation.He said the central government "must be more powerful than the federated regions."The Association was reorganized into a federated structure of eleven organizational member provinces.

federated adjective
(SEARCHES)
computing
  specialized allowing many separate computer resources, such as collections of data (= information), to be searched at the same time: federated search Librarians can help users wade through databases by using federated search engines.federated access Federated access enables data to be accessed directly from its original location.federated database The data is stored in the federated database.
More examplesFewer examplesTo users and applications, data sources appear to belong to a single federated database.With larger catalogs of images, and federated or distributed search databases, I hope looking for art online will become less of a challenge and more of a pleasure. A federated network identity delivers the benefit of simplified sign-on to users by granting rapid access to resources.Independent systems connect to the Learning Resource Exchange to share learning resources in a federated way.

Add to word list
Add to word list
used to describe a group of organizations, regions, countries, etc. that has joined together to form a federation (= a larger organization or government): The global accounting group runs as a federated series of national firms.
IT used to describe a group of systems, documents, etc. that have been joined together to form a single one
